repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Press releases about his work and concerns as a New York State Senator, clippings about Senator Desmond and his wife, correspondence with Albert J. Abrams and reports and drafts on the Presidential primary system.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this manuscript group were donated to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, in December 1978.

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Thomas C. Desmond was born on September 15, 1887, in Middletown, Orange County, New York. He graduated in 1908 from Harvard University. Desmond was also the president and chief engineer for the Newburgh Shipyard, which built ships for the United States Navy. Among the vessels, he was in charge of the building was the U.S.S. Newburgh.

Desmond was the president of the New York Young Republicans club. He served as a member of the New York State Senate from 1931 through 1958 elected from Newburgh, New York. He was also the chairman of the Committee of Military Affairs in 1932 and the Committee on Public Printing in 1931. Desmond was married to Alice Curtis Desmond, an author, and photographer. They had no children.
He died on October 6, 1972, in Boston, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Press releases about his work and concerns as a New York State Senator, 1946-60; clippings about Senator Desmond and his wife, Alice Curtis Desmond, author and photographer, 1956-72; correspondence with Albert J. Abrams, 1965, about naming a street in Newburgh after Desmond; and reports and drafts on the Presidential primary system, 1958-65.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following boxes:

list.item: Box 3 - Press Releases, 1946-1950, Lists, Undated, Automobile Insurance, Index to Contents of Books, 1930-1940, 1945, 1947, 1948
Box 6 - Scrapbooks, 1965-1972, Miscellaneous Correspondence, Undated, Miscellaneous Press Releases, Undated, Miscellaneous Presidential Nominating Procedures, Undated

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Thomas C. Desmond Papers, 1930-1972. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Desmond Papers).
